Dialogue.Page: Deep breaths, Riebeck. You can't jump to conclusions.
Ok, so first, the locked door.
The orb near the top's some vision-activated mechanism I've seen in other ruins, that I'm pretty certain should open the door once you slide it all the way.
But this one seems to be.. jammed by something? It won't open all the way no matter how hard I try.
So, I thought maybe I should try jumping into the pools below, maybe find some secret entrance the others missed. Should be perfectly safe with the suit on.
Now, I didn't find any secret entrances.. but I found something else.
I think.. I think I found a mural of depicting the Nomai.. <Pause> meeting what looks to be ancient Hearthians, crawling out of a pond?

But if this is true, that would mean <color=orange>our ancestors evolved to walk on the surface</color> much earlier than we had thought.. And that we even coexisted for a period of time with the Nomai! It's.. unbelievable! It's a whole new page of Hearthian history!
I think I'm gonna keep this discovery a secret, and gather more data on this discovery from my upcoming archelogical study of the Hanging City before I make an official report.

I don't want Hornfels and Chert to pick it apart and realize it was the Nomai's way of depicting um.. ancient dragonflies or alien flowers. We have found murals of what we can only assume to be alien flora and fauna, after all.
Right, the door.. I've got to chase this lead while the hearth is hot, but I badly want to find out what's hidden inside this forbidden Nomai structure, too.
If only <color=orange>there was some way to at least see what's inside...</color> Then maybe we could at least determine if it's even safe and worth further investigation to get in.

Whoever hears this recording, if you figure out any way through this door, or can do a better job translating the Nomai text here and in the pools below, please keep me posted! I'd love for this Hearthian mystery to be solved at last!
